channel.title: What does this mean?
channel.description: [code]//kbd npcdrop = 50 1077 1 1 npcdrop = 50 1107 1 1 npcdrop = 50 746 1 1 npcdrop = 50 1540 1 100 npcdrop = 50 1149 1 3 npcdrop = 50 2577 1 3 npcdrop = 50 2581 1 3 npcdrop = 50 1079 1 5 npcdrop = 50 4587 1 3 npcdrop = 50 2856 1 1 npcdrop = 50 2857 1 1 npcdrop = 50 1077 1 1 npcdrop = 50 536 1 100[/code] This is in npc drops. What does each number represent?

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:1, topic:333179"]The 50 is the npcID, the 1077 is the item for it to spawn, the 1 is the amount of how many it will spawn, and 1 is the chance of getting it out of 100 (100 = 100% chance).

EX:

npcdrop = 2           536             99           100

This would make npc #2 drop 99 bones each time you kill it.

/facepalm

npcdrop = 50 (this is the npcid obviously)

1077 (this is the item id)

1st #1 (this is the item amount)

2nd #1 (this is the drop chance, in %)

Oh, and you can go fuck yourself. It’s the help section, so don’t “facepalm” at the people who need help…[/quote]
Thanks dude! Man I wish I would rep++ you.

Read full topic
